author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: Governor Lawal asserts no bandit negotiations in Zamfara
text:
In Zamfara State, Governor Dauda Lawal has emphasized that there will be no discussions held with the bandits responsible for the ongoing terror activities within the state.
Participating actively in a procession organized by the youth of Zamfara State, known as the ‘Walk for Peace’ to commemorate Democracy Day, the governor showed his solidarity with the cause.
The procession, commencing at the Government House and culminating at Freedom Square, drew in thousands to exhibit their support for the government’s efforts against banditry.
During his address, Governor Lawal expressed his determination to take all necessary measures to restore peace in every corner of Zamfara State.
Expressing gratitude to the youth coalition for initiating the significant peace walk, the governor highlighted the importance of such initiatives during challenging times.
Stressing the collective responsibility for security, Governor Lawal emphasized the need for cooperation and backing of the system.
Rejecting the negotiation strategy employed by past administrations, Governor Lawal emphasized the decision to refrain from negotiating with bandits due to the negative outcomes experienced.
On the occasion of Democracy Day and with Eid approaching, Governor Lawal announced the early disbursement of June salaries to civil servants in Zamfara State along with the fulfillment of the N30,000 minimum wage promise.
Assuring the continuous progress and support for the state, the governor highlighted advancements in various sectors including security, education, agriculture, health, infrastructure, and empowerment.
The peace walk, as a symbol of unity, conveyed a strong message to those threatening the state, confirming the government’s unwavering commitment to eradicate banditry in Zamfara State.
